row.SpellDescription: A favorite among Stormwind's guards thanks to its patience and stamina.
This breed of wolf prefers hunting in the fog, relying on its smoky hide to camouflage it from unsuspecting prey.
The powerful and unyielding white stallion features heavily in the myths of ancient human tribes.
Rumored to be favored by SI:7 for night missions due to its dark coat.
Its calm temperament makes it ideal to train young children in horseback riding.
Can howl loudly enough to be heard for miles.
Almost none remain in the whole of Azeroth; only the most experienced will have seen one.
Can howl loudly enough to be heard for miles.
Ancient furbolg legends claim that wolves born with a white coat are blessed by Azeroth's two moons.
Corrupted by demonic power and once forced to serve the Shadow Council.
Sturdy and steady; "the horse that built Stormwind."
Once thought to be extinct except in the far north. Highly sought by those preparing for winter.
Can howl loudly enough to be heard for miles.
Male rams will often smash their thick skulls against each other for hours to impress a female. In that way, they're very similar to dwarves.
I've not seen this breed in in ages, but when they're ram tough they stick around. -Veron Amberstill
Male rams will often smash their thick skulls against each other for hours to impress a female. In that way, they're very similar to dwarves.
Male rams will often smash their thick skulls against each other for hours to impress a female. In that way, they're very similar to dwarves.
This hearty mount's ferocious appetite earned it the nickname "Dragon Belly" in the night elf language.
Bred from the fiercest stock anywhere and guaranteed not to bite (much).
Like most undead creatures, it did not choose its fate.
This hearty mount's ferocious appetite earned it the nickname "Dragon Belly" in the night elf language.
Considered one of Azeroth's perfect predators, these agile beasts can sprint through dense forests without making a sound.
Bred from the fiercest stock anywhere and guaranteed not to bite (much).
Bred from the fiercest stock anywhere and guaranteed not to bite (much).
Bred from the fiercest stock anywhere and guaranteed not to bite (much).
"The terradynamic exo-plotters are conjoined by hydraulic imaging to the equilibrium enhancers..." -Binjy Featherwhistle
"The terradynamic exo-plotters are conjoined by hydraulic imaging to the equilibrium enhancers..." -Binjy Featherwhistle
Trained to stand firm in righteous combat.
Forced to recall the model after numerous complaints of an "uncontrollable throttle", Gnomish engineers now refer to a proto-type blunder as a "model B".
"The terradynamic exo-plotters are conjoined by hydraulic imaging to the equilibrium enhancers..." -Binjy Featherwhistle
Considered one of Azeroth's perfect predators, these agile beasts can sprint through dense forests without making a sound.
The lack of spots or stripes marks this beast as a descendant of the most ancient frostsaber line.
Almost none remain in the whole of Azeroth; only the most experienced will have seen one.
Once thought to be nearly extinct, this wolf can still occasionally be seen in the company of a few Horde veterans
Human nobles have long favored this majestic breed for its beautiful golden coat and flowing white mane.
The powerful and unyielding white stallion features heavily in the myths of ancient human tribes.
Bred from the fiercest stock anywhere and guaranteed not to bite (much).
Taming this savage breed requires patience, strength, and a large supply of fake mice and twine.
Bred from the fiercest stock anywhere and guaranteed not to bite (much).
"The terradynamic exo-plotters are conjoined by hydraulic imaging to the equilibrium enhancers..." -Binjy Featherwhistle
"The terradynamic exo-plotters are conjoined by hydraulic imaging to the equilibrium enhancers..." -Binjy Featherwhistle
This historic piece of gnomish engineering was forced into retirement due to its extremely "touchy" gyroscometer.
I've not seen this breed in in ages, but when they're ram tough they stick around."" -Veron Amberstill"
I've not seen this breed in in ages, but when they're ram tough they stick around. -Veron Amberstill
The Forsaken believe that without a purpose, even beasts of burden suffer in undeath.
The Forsaken believe that without a purpose, even beasts of burden suffer in undeath.
The Forsaken believe that without a purpose, even beasts of burden suffer in undeath.
When fallen heroes are raised into undeath, so too are their horses.
When Baron Rivendare became a champion of the Scourge, he condemned his favorite horse to join him in undeath.
"The kodo is the backbone of our people. Wherever the Horde goes - in trade, settlement, or war - there you will find the mighty kodo." - Harb Clawhoof
"The kodo is the backbone of our people. Wherever the Horde goes - in trade, settlement, or war - there you will find the mighty kodo." - Harb Clawhoof
"The kodo is the backbone of our people. Wherever the Horde goes - in trade, settlement, or war - there you will find the mighty kodo." - Harb Clawhoof
An alpha member of the herd, this kodo is a prime example of the mighty creatures which thunder through Desolace.
"The kodo is the backbone of our people. Wherever the Horde goes - in trade, settlement, or war - there you will find the mighty kodo." - Harb Clawhoof
Trained to withstand brutal hand-to-hand combat in the fiercest battlefields.
Bred for their aggressive, unpredictable demeanor by the Kor'kron stablemasters, the Black War Kodos' trumpeting call signifies that blood will soon be shed.
A properly accelerated gnome in battle is a thing of terrible beauty. - High Tinker Mekkatorque
The dwarves value their ram companions for their fearlessness charging into battle.
Bred from the same vicious line of raptors which sired Ohgan and brought victory to the Gurubashi Empire.
When fallen heroes are raised into undeath, so too are their horses.
Like their distant nightsaber cousins, tigers are renowned for their razor-sharp claws, incredible agility, and love of being scratched behind the ears.
Prized by Orgrimmar guards for their keen sense of smell.
WARNING: It craves only fel energy. Not apples. It hates the seeds.
Redeemed by the Light. Devoted to your cause.
Some historians claim that this breed's misty grey coat is the result of ancient Highborne experiments conducted on nightsabers.
Night elves raise frostsaber cubs from infancy, forging lifelong bonds of trust between rider and beast.
We have made a lot of improvements, but they are still based on the Mekkatorque designs. -Milli Featherwhistle
We have made a lot of improvements, but they are still based on the Mekkatorque designs. -Milli Featherwhistle
We have made a lot of improvements, but they are still based on the Mekkatorque designs. -Milli Featherwhistle
Prized by horse breeders for their discipline and steadfastness.
A veteran of some of the toughest battles fought by the Argent Crusade.
A veteran of some of the toughest battles fought by the Argent Crusade.
The Barak Tor'ol ram's thick bony skull and massive horns make it the ideal mount for charging through groups of armored enemies.
The Barak Tor'ol ram's thick bony skull and massive horns make it the ideal mount for charging through groups of armored enemies.
The Barak Tor'ol ram's thick bony skull and massive horns make it the ideal mount for charging through groups of armored enemies.
Longtime allies of the trolls, these jungle hunters form a special bond with their masters. They become steed, guardian, and friend.
Longtime allies of the trolls, these jungle hunters form a special bond with their masters. They become mount, guardian, and friend.
Longtime allies of the trolls, these jungle hunters form a special bond with their masters. They become mount, guardian, and friend.
When fallen heroes are raised into undeath, so too are their horses.
A rare albino of the species first spotted in Desolace. The centaur claim that a white kodo is a harbinger of doom.
An alpha member of the herd, this kodo is a prime example of the mighty creatures which thunder through Desolace.
An alpha member of the herd, this kodo is a prime example of the mighty creatures which thunder through the Northern Barrens.
The wolves of the Horde are befriended, not domesticated.
The wolves of the Horde are befriended, not domesticated.
The wolves of the Horde are befriended, not domesticated.
Rumor has it that this breed was named after the renowned archdruid Malfurion Stormrage.
Raised in the Alterac Mountains by the Frostwolf Clan.
The Stormpike clan's mount trainers have a tradition of etching their names onto the left horn of every battle ram they raise.
The only known Razzashi Raptors were said to have been in the custody of Bloodlord Mandokir in Zul'Gurub. This species of raptor has not been seen in many years.
The last known Zulian tigers were kept by High Priest Thekal, deep within Zul'Gurub. They are said to have been hunted into extinction.
Although many varieties of Qiraji Battle Tank can still be found in the ruins of Ahn'Qiraj today, the darkest of the species were only seen on the day the Scarab gong was rung.
This (relatively) domesticated silithid is at home only in the desert sands of Ahn'Qiraj.
This (relatively) domesticated silithid is at home only in the desert sands of Ahn'Qiraj.
This (relatively) domesticated silithid is at home only in the desert sands of Ahn'Qiraj.
This (relatively) domesticated silithid is at home only in the desert sands of Ahn'Qiraj.
Although many varieties of Qiraji Battle Tank can still be found in the ruins of Ahn'Qiraj today, the darkest of the species were only seen on the day the Scarab gong was rung.
Although many varieties of Qiraji Battle Tank can still be found in the ruins of Ahn'Qiraj today, the darkest of the species were only seen on the day the Scarab gong was rung.
The moods of these tempestuous mounts are known to shift as unpredictably and as violently as their physical forms.
Slow and steady might not always win you the race but it'll get you there... eventually.
They love lions in Stormwind, and the gryphon is half lion. Of course they might not like which half. -Gryphon Master Talonaxe
They love lions in Stormwind, and the gryphon is half lion. Of course they might not like which half. -Gryphon Master Talonaxe
They love lions in Stormwind, and the gryphon is half lion. Of course they might not like which half. -Gryphon Master Talonaxe
The Horde had dragons, we had the gryphons. We won that war. - Ilsa Blusterbrew
After being freed from vicious harpies by Cairne and Thrall, many of these creatures became valuable companions of the Horde.
After being freed from vicious harpies by Cairne and Thrall, many of these creatures became valuable companions of the Horde.
After being freed from vicious harpies by Cairne and Thrall, many of these creatures became valuable companions of the Horde.
I still don't get why they fly faster when you put armor on them. -Drakma
The Horde had dragons, we had the gryphons. We won that war. - Ilsa Blusterbrew
The Horde had dragons, we had the gryphons. We won that war. - Ilsa Blusterbrew
The Horde had dragons, we had the gryphons. We won that war. - Ilsa Blusterbrew
I still don't get why they fly faster when you put armor on them. -Drakma
I still don't get why they fly faster when you put armor on them. -Drakma
I still don't get why they fly faster when you put armor on them. -Drakma
"The terradynamic exo-plotters are conjoined by hydraulic imaging to the equilibrium enhancers..." -Binjy Featherwhistle
"Their plumage is more beautiful than any other. Subtlety is for the birds! I mean... other birds." -Viera Sunwhisper
Patient and strong, the Elekk exemplify the Draenei attitude towards the hardships of life.
Basking in the power of M'uru has strengthened its will.
A loyal companion to any who would protect Silvermoon.
Despite their docile nature, talbuks have been known to gore seasoned warriors to death when threatened.
Some of our brethren prefer horses, but the hawkstrider will always be the true symbol of Silvermoon. -Winaestra
Despite their docile nature, talbuks have been known to gore seasoned warriors to death when threatened.
Despite their docile nature, talbuks have been known to gore seasoned warriors to death when threatened.
Despite their docile nature, talbuks have been known to gore seasoned warriors to death when threatened.
Despite their docile nature, talbuks have been known to gore seasoned warriors to death when threatened.
Some of our brethren prefer horses, but the hawkstrider will always be the true symbol of Silvermoon. -Winaestra
Some of our brethren prefer horses, but the hawkstrider will always be the true symbol of Silvermoon. -Winaestra
Some of our brethren prefer horses, but the hawkstrider will always be the true symbol of Silvermoon. -Winaestra
Their plumage is more beautiful than any other. Subtlety is for the birds! I mean... other birds. -Viera Sunwhisper
Their plumage is more beautiful than any other. Subtlety is for the birds! I mean... other birds. -Viera Sunwhisper
You watch what happens when their master is attacked and you will see those birds in a whole new light. - Raider Bork
Patient and strong, the Elekk exemplify the Draenei attitude towards the hardships of life.
Patient and strong, the Elekk exemplify the Draenei attitude towards the hardships of life.
An alpha member of the herd, this elekk is a prime example of the mighty creatures which thunder through Northern Nagrand.
An alpha member of the herd, this elekk is a prime example of the mighty creatures which thunder through Northern Nagrand.
An alpha member of the herd, this elekk is a prime example of the mighty creatures which thunder through Northern Nagrand.
Was one of the most vicious steeds stabled in Karazhan.
The most aggressive nether drakes were awarded those heroes who showed significant prowess and commitment in the gladiatorial arena.
The orcs once hunted these graceful herd animals as part of the om'riggor rite of passage ceremony.
The orcs once hunted these graceful herd animals as part of the om'riggor rite of passage ceremony.
The orcs once hunted these graceful herd animals as part of the om'riggor rite of passage ceremony.
The orcs once hunted these graceful herd animals as part of the om'riggor rite of passage ceremony.
The orcs once hunted these graceful herd animals as part of the om'riggor rite of passage ceremony.
Nether Rays are among the most trusted, versatile mounts in all of Outland and beyond.
Nether Rays are among the most trusted, versatile mounts in all of Outland and beyond.
Nether Rays are among the most trusted, versatile mounts in all of Outland and beyond.
Nether Rays are among the most trusted, versatile mounts in all of Outland and beyond.
Nether Rays are among the most trusted, versatile mounts in all of Outland and beyond.
Al'ar was the beloved pet of Kael'thas Sunstrider, who often boasted that death would never claim it. Perhaps he was right.
The rest be forgotten to walk upon the ground, clipped wings and shame. -Word of the Raven
After promising to fly you to the ends of Outland, the netherwing drake was eventually drawn to the blue skies of Azeroth as well.
After promising to fly you to the ends of Outland, the netherwing drake was eventually drawn to the blue skies of Azeroth as well.
After promising to fly you to the ends of Outland, the netherwing drake was eventually drawn to the blue skies of Azeroth as well.
After promising to fly you to the ends of Outland, the netherwing drake was eventually drawn to the blue skies of Azeroth as well.
After promising to fly you to the ends of Outland, the netherwing drake was eventually drawn to the blue skies of Azeroth as well.
After promising to fly you to the ends of Outland, the netherwing drake was eventually drawn to the blue skies of Azeroth as well.
In true goblin fashion, Landro Longshot has put a stranglehold on the distribution of these mysterious incorporeal mounts.
Historians claim that these incorporeal beasts were created when Draenor exploded, unleashing energies that warped the world's flora and fauna.
Only the swiftest heroes venturing into the troll temple of Zul'Aman were able to subdue these rare battle mounts.
Brewers retired this mount from active advertising service after complaints that the beasts were "too temperamental" to control in major cities.
Dwarves attribute this breed's even temperament to rigorous training, but other races argue that a daily diet of strong ale has something to do with it.
Members of the Cenarion Circle have shared a long and prosperous partnership with their hippogryph allies. When conflict is unavoidable, the Cenarion War Hippogryph is called into service.
Only the most talented engineers have the courage and the mental stamina to create a flying machine that boasts stability and safety. Turbo-charging one is just crazy!
The backbone of the Alliance air force is comprised predominantly of gnomish flying machines due to their maneuverability and speed.
The most aggressive nether drakes were awarded those heroes who showed significant prowess and commitment in the gladiatorial arena.
The most aggressive nether drakes were awarded those heroes who showed significant prowess and commitment in the gladiatorial arena.
First designed as a booster for a much larger rocket, the X-51 was determined to give the perfect thrust capacity for a single rider payload.
What it lacks in safety features it more than makes up for in speed and style. Not for the faint of heart.
I may question Prince Kael'thas's loyalties, but never his style. -Elrodan
Be it into the flood, or into the fire, this one will go where you require.
Uniquely aggressive and pugnacious elekk bulls are culled from the herd and sold to Ethereal traders. The traders then train the bulls for combat and sell them to owners unconcerned about safety.
Some horses merely adopt the dark. This horse was born in it, molded by it.
Zhevras are rarely used as mounts in Azeroth due to their stubborn nature and tendency to bite.
The most aggressive nether drakes were awarded those heroes who showed significant prowess and commitment in the gladiatorial arena.
Zhevras are rarely used as mounts in Azeroth due to their stubborn nature and tendency to bite.
You can't remember exactly how you got this mount. Then again, you can't remember much of anything that happens at Brewfest.
Coren Direbrew won this prize after drinking a Tauren druid under the table - and the druid was in bear form. It was one of Direbrew's proudest moments.
He's big, he's ready for battle, and he's a bear. What more could you want in a mount?

row.SpellName: Winged Steed of the Ebon Blade
row.SpellDescription: Dead or alive, you're coming with me.
The frost vrykul believe that wearing a necklace of polar bear claws will grant them otherworldly strength.
Even the dead need a lift every now and then.
Difficult to build and to maintain, these hogs more than make up for their expense through sheer cool factor.
The most aggressive nether drakes were awarded those heroes who showed significant prowess and commitment in the gladiatorial arena.
Whenever you ride this mount, you feel the urge to shout, "Cry havoc and let slip the murlocs of war!"
Always speak politely to an enraged dragon.
Come not between the dragon and his wrath.
Lost time is never found again. Oh, never mind I found it. -Chronormu
You should never listen to minstrels' fancies. A dragon would never hurt a soul, unless they tried to hurt him first.
But the most important rule, the rule you can never forget, no matter how much he cries, no matter how much he begs, never feed him after midnight.
The taunka use black polar bear pelts in their religious rites, usually at the funerals of those who hunt black polar bears.
It never pays to leave a live dragon out of the equation.
Normally placid beasts, these intelligent animals form a strong bond with their riders, making them loyal and fearless in battle.
Sure-footed and unflappable, these dark-furred mammoths are prized for their steady temperament going into battle.
Directly descended from the original progenitor of the mammoth race, wooly mammoths are considered more feral and primal than their shorter-haired cousins.
This wild variant of the mammoth is not bred for riding. Most wooly mammoths are captured in the wild and tamed by their riders, resulting in a fierce, cunning mount.
The Sons of Hodir believe that riding an ice-white mammoth will protect the rider from frostbite and snow blindness.
Many ice giants claim that they have trained their favored white mammoths to trigger avalanches with their trumpeting calls.
The vrykul were the first to recognize their potential. Or maybe the second, depending on how you look at it.
Bred specifically to honor those heroes who showed exceptional resilience and fortitude facing the dangers in Northrend.
The Storm Peaks! There we will find the beast strong enough to bear me into battle. -Skadi the Ruthless
The only reason for time is so that everything doesn't happen at once.
Bred specifically to honor those heroes who showed significant courage and persistence facing the dangers in Northrend.
I cannot help but wonder if things would have turned out different if the titans had elevated even one more dragonflight. -Alexstrasza
Even the Draconic Native Association tests proved inconclusive in determining if the albino drake is related to a known dragonflight. -Breanni
This ursine mount's swiftness is enhanced by its heavy armor, imbued with magic from Kirin Tor magi.
Your cries of "For the Horde!" will be much more menacing from atop a heavily armored bear that's barreling down on Alliance at top speed.
Killing leaders of the Horde is its own reward, but this intimidating beast is an excellent memento.
This formidable mount is bought with the blood of Alliance leaders, but you would have killed them for free.
Merchants trust only this thundering, mountainous steed to protect them when venturing down Azeroth's most dangerous trade routes.
A common sight on trade routes all across Azeroth, this calm, stalwart mount is the favorite of merchants traveling to exotic and distant markets.
Sporting superb engineering craftsmanship, this chopper is one of the few personal vehicles on Azeroth built for two.
The nice thing is that when they attack, blood almost never stains their feathers. -Mei Francis
They are not native to Northrend, but they have adapted extremely well to the cold. -Mei Francis
The vrykul were the first to recognize their potential. Or maybe the second, depending on how you look at it.
Standard features include a sturdy imbued frostweave frame and real iceweb spider silk threading. Spare head pillow sold separately.
Ancient manuscripts depict merchants traveling across the frozen tundra with these colossal beasts, leading scholars to believe they are the first domesticated mounts.
Riders and merchants alike trust only this strong and steadfast mammoth to carry them safely across the frigid tundra.
Hop aboard this flying carpet to see the shining, shimmering, and splendid world of Azeroth, wonder by wonder.
Once used by giants to carry heavily armored warriors, these grand war mammoths can easily bear more than one rider of less-than-giant stature.
Rarely, a war mammoth is born stronger and more tractable than its peers. These mammoths are dubbed "grand" and carry more than one rider to the front lines.
At home on the narrow, icy trails of the Storm Peaks, these mammoths are the only mounts the ice giants trust to carry large loads and multiple riders.
Due to high winds and avalanches, the Sons of Hodir recommend bringing at least two companions if venturing into the dangerous Storm Peaks.
Dragonhawks are among the deadliest known predators. They are able to spot prey from great distances, rush in, and rend with both talon and beak.
Dragonhawks are among the deadliest known predators. They are able to spot prey from great distances, rush in, and rend with both talon and beak.
This breed of dragonhawk is intensely sought after by those who have an eye for insanely rare modes of travel.
Although raised in Stormwind, this breed showed unusual aptitude for the cold weather in Icecrown.
This raptor breed was originally cultivated by the Drakkari, but has since been adopted by the Darkspear tribe in Northrend.
Wildhammer Fact Checker claims that this specific breed was the first type of ram domesticated by the dwarves when they settled in Dun Morogh.
When a night elf's mount perishes, it is custom for the rider to keep one of the saber's great fangs as a token of remembrance.
When you absolutely, positively have to be there right now. -Rillie Spindlenut
Exodar Elekk are elekk which have been anointed by O'ros, the Naaru who journeyed from Draenor to Azeroth with Velen and his followers.
For a brief time, many orcs would declare themselves "hungry like an Orgrimmar wolf." Some blood elves still use the phrase ironically.
An alpha member of the herd, this kodo is a prime example of the mighty creatures which thunder through Mulgore.
So I says I feel like chicken tonight. Next thing, I am flat out and that thing is trying to see what my eyes taste like. -Bozzle Blastbolt
When fallen heroes are raised into undeath, so too are their horses.
A token of titan craftsmanship hoarded by the Old God, Yogg-Saron. Currently the single largest mechanical gnome head in Azeroth.
Argent Hippogryphs will partner with only the bravest and most battle-tested champions.
His skin more hard than brass was found, that sword nor spear could pierce nor wound.
Not as shiny as the other one, but it's still a great find lads. Brann Bronzebeard
A rare sight. Most disappeared once Baron Rivendare ruled in Stratholme.
"The kodo is the backbone of our people. Wherever the Horde goes - in trade, settlement, or war - there you will find the mighty kodo." - Harb Clawhoof
Can howl loudly enough to be heard for miles.
You raised this thing from a scaly pup - Mor'vek would be so proud. But he'd still make you clean up the mess it made in the corner.
Often caught by fishermen at a young age, these mounts are much more comfortable in the water than they are on land.
These reanimated vessels of destruction do not fear death; they dispense it.
The Forsaken believe that without a purpose, even beasts of burden suffer in undeath.
Some of Azeroth's mightiest dragons have been summoned across the veil between life and death to serve new masters with undying loyalty.

Never seen in Nagrand, the first red elekk calves were born in Azeroth after the Exodar's arrival. Some breeders theorize that the unique coloration is somehow caused by the same radiation which ravaged Bloodmyst Isle.
Many night elves revere these proud mounts because their shimmering coats symbolize the goddess of the moon, Elune.
What do you mean is it dyed? Oh, the bird. We did touch up the red just a little. -Trellis Morningsun
A veteran of some of the toughest battles fought by the Argent Crusade.
An alpha member of the herd, this kodo is a prime example of the mighty creatures which thunder through the Southern Barrens.
The mirror's not so you can look back, but so your foes can see something besides your tailpipes. -Rillie Spindlenut
The Barak Tor'ol ram's thick bony skull and massive horns make it the ideal mount for charging through groups of armored enemies.
Longtime allies of the trolls, these jungle hunters form a special bond with their masters. They become mount, guardian, and friend.
When fallen heroes are raised into undeath, so too are their horses.
The wolves of the Horde are befriended, not domesticated.
Magic in the hands of a genius can do wonderful, miraculous things. Magic in the hands of an idiot can make a giant rooster.
Silver Covenant Hippogryphs are fiercely loyal, both to their riding partners, and to the Alliance.
The Sunreavers of Dalaran select only the swiftest and most formidable of dragonhawks as their mounts.
Comes from a lineage of fine horses that once grazed near the shores of the Well of Eternity.
I demand speed, grace and discipline on the battlefield. This one will serve nicely. -Eressea Dawnsinger
Magic in the hands of a genius can do wonderful, miraculous things. Magic in the hands of an idiot can make a giant rooster.
Magic in the hands of a genius can do wonderful, miraculous things. Magic in the hands of an idiot can make a giant rooster.
Magic in the hands of a genius can do wonderful, miraculous things. Magic in the hands of an idiot can make a giant rooster.
When fallen heroes are raised into undeath, so too are their horses.
Night elves once believed that seeing this light colored saber breed in the wild was an ill omen.
Trained to accept only champions of the Light as a rider.
In life, it could not be tamed, but necromancy and esoteric binding rituals have now combined to bend this indomitable creature to its rider's will.
Given only to those who prove themselves a champion in the Argent Tournament.
A few of the Argent Crusade's swiftest mounts were awarded to those members of the Horde who performed exceptionally during the tournament in Icecrown.
A few of the Argent Crusade's swiftest mounts were awarded to those members of the Alliance who performed exceptionally during the tournament in Icecrown.
Awarded to only the most skilled champions from the Trial of the Crusader, these steeds were chosen for Alliance members from Tirion Fordring's own personal stable.
Awarded to only the most skilled champions from the Trial of the Crusader, these steeds were chosen for Horde members from Tirion Fordring's own personal stable.
She has a lot in common with her mother, except for the being killed and reanimated. But she is young still. -Maloriak
This magnificent beast, adorned in sacred charms and painted with holy imagery, radiates with the warmth of the sun.
At daybreak, the noble Sunwalkers often perform rituals to bless their mounts, imbuing them with holy magic.
Apothecary Hummel painted this masterpiece bright pink for an unrequited love.
Many believe that during their early lives, these wyrms were forced to fight their own kind for the amusement of others. Perhaps that is why they possess a particularly combative temperament.
The famous steed of Arthas Menethil, who serves its master in life and in death. Riding him is truly a feat of strength.
Raised from the chilling depths of Icecrown, Frostbrood Vanquishers are considered among the fiercest and most relentless of all frost wyrms.
Bloodbathed Vanquishers are so named when it is determined that a reanimated frost wyrm died a particularly gruesome and bloody death.
Stabled in the Icecrown Citadel to serve the Lich King's most favored minions.
Draenei exarchs have long marched into war atop these imposing mounts, bred for their razor-sharp tusks.
Only the most distinguished paladins are given the honor of riding this elekk. Its plated armor and purple adornments have been blessed by Prophet Velen himself.
Hippogryphs are highly intelligent, sentient beings; far more than mere "mounts."
Captured by Toby "Mother Goose" Ironbolt on the Borean Tundra, this shaggy beast carries an enormous grudge after being bridled by a gnome.
Stubborn until broken, these underwater mounts provide the swiftest means of travel around the depths of Vashj'ir.
"I remember my first flying carpet... yeti hair and burlap. Not nearly as nice as this one here." - Frozo the Renowned
A beacon of hope; a guiding light in the darkness.
Riding a giant cylinder filled with highly explosive goblin rocket fuel all by yourself is just crazy...so bring a friend.
Legends tell of a spell placed upon a hunting raptor who dared to snarl at young Tyrande Whisperwind as she bathed in a jungle pool. The beast is cursed to wander Azeroth - until it apologizes.
A compilation of nuts, bolts, gears, and treated wood paneling make for an unusually smooth ride.
The turbo trike's tri-wheel design adds superior stability and a smaller turn radius over its two wheeled cousins.
Fire can transform stone in exciting ways, but never let the Stonemother know I said that. -Earthcaller Yevaa
In Deathwing's mad quest to forge new dragons, he ignored amazing breeds never before seen on Azeroth. -Thrall
The Stonemother has shown little concern for the rebellious Aeonaxx, even allowing his spawn to be taken from her realm.
Harnessing the elemental powers of the storm, these majestic beasts crackle like lightning and roar like thunder.
They sicken of the calm who know the storm.
Gentle as a summer breeze, but that says little considering where it came from. -Itesh
Those would be perfect in a pendant, and that would make a fantastic ring. Let me know if this thing sheds or molts or whatever. -Kalinda
Fennimore Quigley is credited with milking the first camel and breaking the record for "longest unintentional flight," all in the same afternoon.
Fennimore Quigley is credited with milking the first camel and breaking the record for "longest unintentional flight," all in the same afternoon.
Fennimore Quigley is credited with milking the first camel and breaking the record for "longest unintentional flight," all in the same afternoon.
Despite their name, Dark Phoenixes are known to have a warm and cheerful disposition.
Don't let the saddle fool you, he's wild, not a tame lion.
The Tol'vir sorcerer Azj'Aqir was said to possess a scepter that would allow him to control a Qiraj battle tank outside of its Silithus home.
Dark spirits flee before the radiance of its presence.
Fears only fire.
Sandstone Drakes were studied in great detail long ago by the famed alchemist Walleye Sprysprocket. It has even been said that Walleye developed potions to mimic the drakes' physiology.
I thought the thing was ill until it took to the air. It flies as true as any of my own. -Alexstrasza
Vicious in battle and surprisingly loyal, this battle scorpion serves only those who show true commitment to a powerful guild.

The purebred royal raptors of Zul'Gurub, these mounts have become a rare sight in Stranglethorn Vale. The Gurubashi have been known to fly into a rage at the sight of any non-troll riding one of their precious beasts.
The jungle trolls have long coveted panther fangs, using them for rituals or as ingredients in mojos.
Dragonhawks liberated from troll enslavement are considered among the most loyal of all their kin.
Flameward Hippogryphs revel in the defeat of Ragnaros, Lord of Fire.
Legends state that the Pureblood line may be traced back to the very creation of the Firelands.
Felfire is deadly to the touch. Luckily, the hawk can suppress the flames, choosing not to incinerate its rider in an emerald effigy.
Millagazor was a fire hawk loyal to Ragnaros. At this time it is unknown how many of Millagazor's eggs were corrupted.
One-time companion of Kanga the Primal, the fallen troll hero. The raptor's name is unknown, for Kanga only spoke to it in bear form.
The Amani trolls decorate these ferocious mounts in magic amulets and ceremonial masks as a way to venerate the bear god Nalorakk.
"One has not truly lived until they have felt the tidal current rushing through their hair while atop a majestic seahorse," said no one. Ever.
Unearthed recently in an ancient tomb, this mighty winged lion may have once served one of the ancient Tol'vir princes.
Armored to withstand collisions in battle.
At Warchief Hellscream's command, Horde trainers began raising wolves to thrive in the shock and ferocity of sustained combat.
Heroes who proved their might in the gladiatorial arenas during the Cataclysm were awarded the most exceptional of the twilight drake broods.
As with their matriarch, Alysrazor, the fury and fervor of these elemental avians are unquenchable.
A rarity amongst the tallstrider breeds of Kalimdor, but easily recognized by its pungent dead seaweed aroma.
Heroes who proved their might in the gladiatorial arenas during the Cataclysm were awarded the most exceptional of the twilight drake broods.
This vibrant breed can only be found in the forests of Darkmoon Island.
The joys of Noblegarden are best when celebrated with this loyal, loving, and blandly-colored freak of nature.
It's like red but not quite.
Fennimore Quigley is credited with milking the first camel and breaking the record for "longest unintentional flight," all in the same afternoon.
It is a sad fact that even the wise and majestic hippogryph may fall prey to corruption.
These fearsome mounts have a habit of suddenly breaking out into dance amid battle, much to the annoyance of their riders.
Images of this breed are often found on kegs of watered-down dwarven brew.
Longs for the day it may return to its home in Gilneas.
A symbol of justice throughout all known realms.
When you said an old friend was coming back, this was not quite what I expected. -Bralla Cloudwing
How do you not fall right through that thing? -Maztha
Blazing Drakes exhibit a boundless passion for life, and are considered by many to be among the most loyal mounts on Azeroth.
Whatever dark magic once compelled the Twilight Harbinger is now broken... or is it?
Alexstrasza, the former dragon Aspect of Life, is known to be a kind and patient mentor. Under her tutelage, only the most dedicated pupils acquire the title of "Life-Binder's Handmaiden."

Some believe Experiment 12-B is the result of a covert SI-7 initiative, others consider it the outcome of embyronic tinkering by goblin scientists. No matter the case, this much is certain: given its strength, speed and agility, Experiment 12-B was a success!
You are Azeroth's true guardians and the future of this world is in your hands, for the dawning of the age of mortals has begun. - Alexstrasza
Fighting the Burning Legion millennia ago, this valiant drake fell to corruption after its body was infused with raw demonic magic.
Jade Cloud Serpents are light and agile; quick and deadly.
"Normally bugs are for bait, but how could you look into its eyes and even think that?" -Nat Pagle
This "mount," awarded by the Lorewalkers of Pandaria, is a reward to the hero of their organization.
Trade Prince Gallywix recently ordered dozens of these glittering jewel-encrusted mounts to roam the grounds of his pleasure palace.
Cherished for their heavy carrying capacity and steady gait, these stalwart beasts are the mount of choice for most native Pandaren.
"Packaged upgrades include; dual-lantern fog lights, emergency brew keg, and genuine Tanji leather seat." - Turtlemaster Odai
Formed by Ragnaros himself as a gift for the daughter he never had.
When you can't run, you crawl, and when you can't crawl you find someone to carry you.
Legends say that an ancient pandaren emperor crafted the first jeweled panther for his son after the boy's twin brother died of an illness.
Legends say that an ancient pandaren emperor crafted the first jeweled panther for his son after the boy's twin brother died of an illness.
Legends say that an ancient pandaren emperor crafted the first jeweled panther for his son after the boy's twin brother died of an illness.
Legends say that an ancient pandaren emperor crafted the first jeweled panther for his son after the boy's twin brother died of an illness.
These beasts of burden are known to carry over five times their own weight and to be capable of lasting several days without food or water.
Riding Yaks are bred to be slimmer and more agile than their kin.
The Klaxxi ride massive scorpions into battle against their enemies. A carapace hardened by amber provides superior protection while on the battlefield.
Azure Cloud Serpents are believed by the Pandaren to be harbingers of good fortune.
Golden Cloud Serpents are a treasure to be enjoyed by all who visit the continent of Pandaria.
From their infancy, Thundering Cloud Serpents are drawn to storms. They have been known to chase lightning through the blackened, roiling clouds, and to bathe in the pouring rain.
Heroes who proved their might in the gladiatorial arenas during the Cataclysm were awarded the most exceptional of the twilight drake broods.
Favorite pets of the ancient Mogu princes, Quilen make loyal and fearless companions and mounts.
When Kyparite is depleted of its amber essence it becomes fairly resistant to the corrosion from rocket fuel.
This rocket was originally designed to speed up the rotation of the world making for shorter nights. Gnomes with insomnia can have lofty goals.
Onyx Cloud serpents are known to be more aggressive and daring than their cousins, the Heavenly Onyx Cloud Serpents.
Crimson Cloud Serpents are given to flights of fancy,"" striking out on a whim for seemingly random journeys, sometimes for days at a time."
Heavenly Onyx Cloud Serpents are born with violet scales covering the entirety of their body. Over time, these scales darken to the color of onyx.
Heavenly Crimson Cloud Serpents are considered to be among the noblest of dragons.
Warmth and hope emanate from this great creature, which glows like a sunrise over the mountains.
Warmth and wisdom emanate from this great creature, which glows like moonlight passing through the finest jade.
Warmth and serenity emanate from this great creature, which glows like the cloudless sky of a summer afternoon.
It is believed that Astral Cloud Serpents possess answers to some of life's greatest mysteries. Pity they can't talk.
The majestic crane is a treasured friend of the pandaren.
The crane is a symbol of wisdom and nobility, their ability to carry us into the skies is nothing short of miraculous. - Jaluu the Generous
The crane is a symbol of wisdom and nobility. Their ability to carry us into the skies is nothing short of miraculous. - Jaluu the Generous
Grummles traveling Kun-Lai Summit by night prefer to ride this dark-haired yak to remain unseen, though they remove the bells from its caparison first.
Riding Yaks are bred to be slimmer and more agile than their kin.
Riding Yaks are bred to be slimmer and more agile than their kin.
Riding Yaks are bred to be slimmer and more agile than their kin.
"Normally bugs are for bait, but how could you look into its eyes and even think that?" -Nat Pagle
Cherished for their heavy carrying capacity and steady gait, these stalwart beasts are the mount of choice for most native Pandaren.
Cherished for their heavy carrying capacity and steady gait, these stalwart beasts are the mount of choice for most native Pandaren.
Cherished for their heavy carrying capacity and steady gait, these stalwart beasts are the mount of choice for most native Pandaren.
Cherished for their heavy carrying capacity and steady gait, these stalwart beasts are the mount of choice for most native Pandaren.
Cherished for their heavy carrying capacity and steady gait, these stalwart beasts are the mount of choice for most native Pandaren.
"Packaged upgrades include; dual-lantern fog lights, emergency brew keg, and genuine Tanji leather seat." - Turtlemaster Odai
"Packaged upgrades include; dual-lantern fog lights, emergency brew keg, and genuine Tanji leather seat." - Turtlemaster Odai
"Packaged upgrades include; dual-lantern fog lights, emergency brew keg, and genuine Tanji leather seat." - Turtlemaster Odai
"Packaged upgrades include; dual-lantern fog lights, emergency brew keg, and genuine Tanji leather seat." - Turtlemaster Odai
"Packaged upgrades include; dual-lantern fog lights, emergency brew keg, and genuine Tanji leather seat." - Turtlemaster Odai
The plumage of the Crimson Phoenix is said to represent prosperity and happiness.
From their infancy, Thundering Cloud Serpents are drawn to storms. They have been known to chase lightning through the blackened, roiling clouds, and to bathe in the pouring rain.
"When waking a tiger, use a long stick. Better yet, tell your friend to wake the tiger instead." --Pandaren Proverb
"When waking a tiger, use a long stick. Better yet, tell your friend to wake the tiger instead." --Pandaren Proverb
"When waking a tiger, use a long stick. Better yet, tell your friend to wake the tiger instead." --Pandaren Proverb
It takes unflagging patience and a gentle touch to train obstinate mountain goats for riding.
An ancient Mogu artifact awarded to those who are deeply committed to the discovery and sharing of Pandaren lore.
It takes unflagging patience and a gentle touch to train obstinate mountain goats for riding.
It takes unflagging patience and a gentle touch to train obstinate mountain goats for riding.
Trained from a young age, these massive kushan are taught to thunder into battle carrying a full saurok warband.
This token of honor is a gift from the Lorewalkers of Pandaria. Flying manual seemingly not included, however.
From their infancy, Thundering Cloud Serpents are drawn to storms. They have been known to chase lightning through the blackened, roiling clouds, and to bathe in the pouring rain.
Both the name and color of this majestic phoenix are believed to symbolize rebirth.
The colors of this rare phoenix's plumage are said to bring great fortune.
The Violet Phoenix's plumage is said to symbolize a union of opposing forces.
The residents of Pandaria salute your enthusiasm for wildlife preservation. They do have concerns about housing 150 animals per visit, though.
A glorious feat of engineering, the sky golem takes traditional shredder technology to a whole new level (and altitude!).
One of Pandaria's most elusive creatures, said to bring good fortune to its rider.
This noble gryphon is as staunch a battle companion as any member of the Alliance could ask for.
This ferocious beast, renowned among wyvern handlers, was one of the first mounts chosen to take part in the Horde's Dominance Offensive.
Gryphons' keen eyesight allows them to see over vast distances and warn their riders of any dangers that lie ahead.
Wyverns hail from some of the most inhospitable regions of Kalimdor, making them masters of adapting to any environment.
Only those heroic souls who surmount every challenge the mogu tyrants place before them can proudly fly the skies on a war-prepared skyscreamer.
When you see a hurricane coming, you get out of the way. Horridon would fight the hurricane and win.
Not all of Medivh's victims are gone for good.
"When ya fight alongside raptors, ya want a mount dey can't eat." -Unknown dinomancer
There is an old Zandalari saying about wild direhorns: "Run!"
The masks aren't to control the direhorn; they are so no one sees your face when it turns on you.
The festive coloring belies deadly intent.
"They are lethal at eight months, very lethal." -Hemet Nesingwary Jr.
Raptors have spread to nearly all of the lands of Azeroth. It is uncertain whether the trolls led them or followed them.
Speed, cunning, and ferocity are the things trolls and raptors admire about each other.
"Raptors are as loyal as they are vicious. If you ain't friend, you are food." -Kijara
These cloud serpents have scales that... are the color of clouds, actually.
This is a descendant of the irascible Nalak. Lightning erupts from its scales and arcs over the saddle. Dare you sit?
Although Ji-Kun feasted on the failed creations of mogu flesh-shapers, her progeny is willing to eat more pedestrian carcasses.
This monstrous, flesh-eating bat is the undisputed ruler of the night skies.
Sharp at both ends and crafty in the middle. Leave it to the trolls to think this was a good idea.
Leave it to the blood elves to pick the red one.
Each step echoes with the rage of your three opponents.
This rare breed of dragonhawk is a mark of honor in the Horde, gifted by the blood elves. It reflects your tireless effort to amass a small army of mounts.
After you amassed a massive menagerie of 200 mounts, the animal authorities of the Alliance sent you a means to keep them in line (and out of their hair).
For years pandaren believed these creatures to be untamable. Just ask the first pandaren to do so, Henshi "Limp Along" Homebrew.
This majestic creature is Brightwing's older brother. He affirms that she was, in fact, adopted.
Its ethereal spirit is barely contained by its iron shell. The penultimate creation of Salanar the Horseman, these powerful steeds were once thought to have all been destroyed.
The blades adorning this mount's armor are designed to both inspire fear and pre-slice meals for the warsaber.
Only rewarded to those who have bested their foes in battle.
This formidable creature's lineage may be traced to Galakras, and yet further to Galakrond, one of the most infamous of all proto-dragons.
The Kor'kron use only the mightiest wolves for their mounts, bedecking them in armor that would break the backs of lesser creatures.
The Kor'kron Juggernaut is a weapon of unbridled destruction, born from the mind of Garrosh Hellscream and made real by his engineers.
Some people say that riding an ashhide mushan will result in favorable health and increased prosperity. These people are called "mount vendors."
This ebony cloud serpent is a lightning-wreathed vision of such rarity as to have driven many mortals to madness.
These cloud serpents always look elegant and slim in classic black.
These brilliantly colored cloud serpents have scales that are a mixture of ruby, gold, and nearly violet.
These brilliantly colored cloud serpents have scales that range from gold to pink. Or we could call it coral.
These majestic animals come in various colorings, but the emerald variety can only be tamed by the magic of friendship.
Iron Horde beastmasters bred this rylak for war and then girded it for battle in black steel and smoldering flame.
A nightmarish steed of hardened steel and vengeful spirits, this companion will follow you to the depths of the Firelands and back without complaint.
The difference between a smile and a grin is the difference between a kiss and tasting.
Filled with the hatred of an ancient god, the dread raven are the Arakkoa's most trusted guardians.
Can't fly, but can creep very quickly.
Molten to the core!
Once "befriended", a gronnling will happily carry its rider to their death.
Tiny notches cover the hooves of this variation of clefthoof, allowing it to safely scale mountainous regions in search of food.
It wasn't until you owned this mount that you understood how much the world of Draenor would test you. Clefthoof hair gets in everything!
A translucent layer of down hair covers this breed's leathery hide, acting as the perfect insulation for cold environments.
Members of the Warsong clan have long hunted these clefthoof to use their crimson-hued skin for battle standards.
Blackhand is said to have personally designed the fiery armaments used on the Iron Horde's clefthoof battle mounts.
The elekk's long trunk allows it to sniff out sources of food, avoid danger, and steal snacks from your bags when you're not looking.
The draenei perfected elekk husbandry long ago, adorning the creatures with Light-infused crystals to make them more docile.
Some legends say the draenei first befriended the elekk after one of the beasts saved an injured scout from a pack of vicious podlings.
Ever since acquiring this mount, you have been plagued by strange fever dreams of hippety-hoppety clippety-cloppety elekk on parade.
It is said an elekk never forgets. No wonder it despises the Iron Horde, considering the torment the orcs put the beast through.
Refuses to run unless its head is covered in heavy, spiked metal. It's an ego thing.
It's not the metal helmet that attracts mates; it's the sweet mohawk.
Subsists almost entirely on a diet of frozen berries. Though it finds slow off-worlders equally tasty.
Never... ever... EVER... let it smell bacon on you.
If it didn't have the cool tusk ring, it would feel so silly in that outfit.
If you want a gentle ride, go find a "tame happytusk" or something.
"Domesticated" does not mean "friendly." Bring some treats.
Its snout is not just cold but wet. Not a pleasant way to wake up.
Sheds its tusks once a year. Is extremely shy until they grow back.
Thoroughly trained in how to snort, trot, and stomp on the faces of its enemies.
Riverwallows are one of the heartiest beasts on Draenor, resulting in their increased stamina and distinctive coloring.
This animal's color mimics the clear blue of Draenor's river shallows, making it almost invisible to aquatic predators.
Special webbing that grows on the soles of the mudback's feet gives them extra traction in mud and slick terrain.
Aggressive and territorial, the mosshide is known for hiding in river-shore scrub and ambushing unwary passersby.
From the bowels of the nether is summoned a creature of pure hatred, bent on burning down any life in its way.
Looking into the eyes of this mystical beast is like peering into the heart of the sun. Goggles are recommended when you're riding.
Draenei poets have likened this talbuk's coloring to shadows cast by moonlight in an ashen forest.
Draenei have relied on this mount, the swiftest of all talbuk, to relay messengers and their missives safely to their destinations.
Prized for its intelligence, this breed of talbuk can be trained to execute defensive kicks and gorings in battle.
These breezestriders' red coloration reflects their temperament: sanguine, fierce, and courageous.
This talbuk subsists completely on a diet of thistles and thorns, making its insides as tough as its outside.
Until it head-butts you below the belt, it has not truly accepted you as its rider.
Because sharp teeth and claws weren't enough.
A trainer once tried to put decorative metal in his steelmaw wolf's mouth. He had to wait three days to get it back.
Has a will of iron but is a sweetheart if you give it a clefthoof bone to chew on.
It's trained to survive the harsh climate of Frostfire Ridge, so it snuggles as if its life depended on it.
It has an armored spike on its tail. Scratch its belly at your own risk.
Enormously cute as a puppy. Slightly less so now.
Amidst the cold heights of Frostfire, the frostwolves hunt anything they can catch. The fastest among them eat well.
Believed to reside mostly in the north. Hates weddings.
Cautious by direwolf standards, the dustmane can only be coaxed to ride with something it considers special.
Often referred to as the "Goblin Lawn Mower", this growling behemoth treats enemies like they are made of grass... ready to be mown down.
Forged by human, gnome, and dwarf, this armored masterpiece is designed to slice a tauren into a tri-tip dinner with a flick of the handlebars.
Thankfully they move fast and mostly leave the smell behind them.
Loves the sun, hates everything else.
These sleek foxes can prowl amongst newly-fallen leaves without making a sound, even at this size.
The garn are the most fierce predators on Draenor, and always hunt in packs.
Its long, serrated limbs drip with the blood of its enemies and/or mate.
"Is the emerald drake rare? You have no idea. If I had a silver for every time someone asked me about one, I could have retired years ago." --Mei Francis
Why drive yourself around when you can hire someone to do it for you?
Transportation is a precise business.

Corrupted by the presence of the Dark Star in Draenor, the Voidtalons resisted being broken by the Shadowmoon Clan and were ultimately destroyed by Ner'zhul. Only a single egg remains, lost in the void.
Infused with arcane power, the Mystic Runesaber has long been hidden by chaotic nether energies. Recently they have emerged from the shadows in search of ley lines to sate their thirst for magic.

Forged deep within Hellfire Citadel by a mad blacksmith, the Felsteel Annihilator combines the metalworking knowledge of the Iron Horde with the chaotic fel energies of the Burning Legion into an unholy union of steel and flame.
Bathed in the blood of demons, these corrupted Dread Ravens are significantly more aggressive, and will often kill one another if kept in confinement.
Equipped with head-mounted Critter Destroyer 9000.
The spiked ball on the tail is strong enough to crush through even the most reinforced Alliance defenses.
A mighty wolf of Draenor, touched by the fel energies unleashed by Gul'dan in Tanaan Jungle. It has not gone completely mad... yet.
One of the gronnlings of Tanaan Jungle caught in the eruption of fel energies unleashed by Gul'dan, and now beholden to an unquenchable lust for chaos.
One of the gronnlings of Tanaan Jungle caught in the eruption of fel energies unleashed by Gul'dan, and now beholden to an unquenchable lust for chaos.
One of the gronnlings of Tanaan Jungle caught in the eruption of fel energies unleashed by Gul'dan, and now beholden to an unquenchable lust for chaos.
This little gronnling is well-known for smashing his way into garrison inns and making a mess of the pots and pans.
The Illidari have broken some lesser demons for use against their Legion masters.
These magical companions are the wardens of peaceful, primordial groves within the Emerald Dream.
The one and only source for the rare culinary ingredient: cursed bacon.
Redeemed by the Light. Devoted to your cause.
Veterans of the battle for Outland's Hellfire Penninsula are traumatized by thoughts of these beasts to this day.
No one quite knows when the legend of Grumpus began in Draenor, but his toys are just the worst.
The extra-light equipment on this chromatic rylak allows it to swoop and glide through the clouds easily, free from the bounds of the land below.
The Grove Wardens of the Emerald Dream were some of the first to fall to the corrupting influence of the Nightmare.
Armored to withstand collisions in battle.
Even the dead need a lift every now and then.
Captured from the renegade blood elves at Eclipse Point, these purple dragonhawks were often sought after by Scryers posted to the Sanctum of the Stars.
The spirit of Huln Highmountain's pet moose.
A special creation of Lord Illidan gifted to his most trusted demon hunters.
Fickle and savage, these drakes slip in and out of time until they find a worthy rider.
At Warchief Hellscream's command, Horde trainers began raising wolves to thrive in the shock and ferocity of sustained combat.
Redeemed by the Light. Devoted to your cause.
The Illidari were able to break one of these fiery beasts for use as an unstoppable, fearless mount against the Legion.
The sheer amount of raw red berries these fierce omnivors consume gives them their distinctive eye color.
The shimmering hides of these deceptively fierce and coordinated beasts is intended to confuse and disorient prey.
Capable of hiding in a fog bank until prey approaches, then slicing them open with one claw-raised jump.
Adept at blending into dense, magical forests, such as one may find around the Broken Isles.
Only the sturdiest-forged chains can restrain this beast.
These elusive fish prefer to skulk in the deepest reaches of the Great Sea, searching the darkness for food.
You are the only one that remembered.
Years of chain-chugging potions in Dalaran's sewer system have allowed him to grow large, agile, and shadow resistant.
At daybreak, the noble Sunwalkers often perform rituals to bless their mounts, imbuing them with holy magic.
Only the most distinguished paladins are given the honor of riding this elekk. Its plated armor and purple adornments have been blessed by Prophet Velen himself.
A loyal companion to any who would protect Silvermoon.
One of the bold equines of the Broken Isles, unmatched among the steeds of Azeroth in ferocity and strength.
One of the bold equines of the Broken Isles, unmatched among the steeds of Azeroth in ferocity and strength.
One of the bold equines of the Broken Isles, unmatched among the steeds of Azeroth in ferocity and strength.
One of the bold equines of the Broken Isles, unmatched among the steeds of Azeroth in ferocity and strength.
One of the bold equines of the Broken Isles, unmatched among the steeds of Azeroth in ferocity and strength.
One of the bold equines of the Broken Isles, unmatched among the steeds of Azeroth in ferocity and strength.
Deep within the hungering chasms of the Great Sea, swarms of Fathom Dwellers sway like a great floating carpet, sightlessly in the dark.
Born, bred and battle tested in Gilneas.
The most devastating technology money can buy.
Exquisite, dignified and deadly.
A favorite of warriors of the Exodar.
Jepetto may have over done it a little...
Ancient mounts of the Highborne, now left to run wild in the Broken Isles, they can rarely be found due to their latent magical powers.
Bred for destruction by an insane warlord in a far-off land, but at least the seat is warm.
Born in the mountains of Stormheim, this terrifying fusion of storm and scale sets the sky ablaze in pursuit of its prey.
Born in the mountains of Stormheim, this terrifying fusion of storm and scale sets the sky ablaze in pursuit of its prey.
Born in the mountains of Stormheim, this terrifying fusion of storm and scale sets the sky ablaze in pursuit of its prey.
Born in the mountains of Stormheim, this terrifying fusion of storm and scale sets the sky ablaze in pursuit of its prey.
Born in the mountains of Stormheim, this terrifying fusion of storm and scale sets the sky ablaze in pursuit of its prey.
Born in the mountains of Stormheim, this terrifying fusion of storm and scale sets the sky ablaze in pursuit of its prey.
One of the heartiest of species that inhabit the slopes of Highmountain, they can survive for months in freezing blizzards.
Little is known about this elusive species of ray, found only in the dark waters surrounding Darkmoon Island.
Three elements have been fused to create this magical disc, which is attuned to your specific magical powers.
Once plentiful, only three seekers remain on Azeroth after generations of battling the corruption of the cosmos.
The child of Xuen, Ban-Lu has served each Grandmaster faithfully for many years.
The spirit of the Great Hunter found you worthy, and now its children will answer your call forevermore.
A powerful red dragon raised in undeath by its own life energies, a true mockery of life.
Also respondes to "Mister Bitey."
You broke it, you bought it.
A jumble of talons and claws that can fly and swim. No one is safe.
If asked to fetch, will most likely bring you back the head of a small mammal or humanoid.
Almost twice as vicious as its Horde counterpart.
Nearly twice as vicious as its Alliance counterpart.
Still one of the most vicious steeds stabled in Karazhan.
Many squires were harmed in the making of this mount.
"My winged children fill the skies. Not this one though."-Aviana
The spikes on this beast can pierce plate armor with ease -- only the most elite riders can even consider mounting this deadly pincushion.

Upon her return to The Nighthold, First Arcanist Thalyssra saw to it that adventurers who helped her liberate Suramar were rewarded with prized mounts from the royal stable.Summoning this mount in Suramar City will also apply Masquerade.
Has very few non-pointy ends.

Arcanagos sought to turn Medivh away from experiments into the arcane, but the influence of Sargeras had corrupted the wizard too deeply, and the great dragon paid for the transgression with eternal, burning agony.
The preferred vehicle for assassinations, they make no sounds when flying - really great for sneaking up on people.
The fanciest of all of the horses.
Windfury. Overload: (2).
They'll never hear you coming.
For the toxin-inclined.
The blood of your enemies won't even show up, blends right in.
What's he so mad about?
His blank horse stare is "vigilance," actually.
Has many valorous points.
The primal landscape of Azeroth was once swarming with elemental creatures of all types.
A deadly combination of fel and horse.
The shadows that trail off of its scales are otherworldly, is this creature from the depths of Azeroth's oceans?
Now you can literally turtle up in the flag room.
Now you can literally turtle up in the flag room.
The threads are so thin and well-stitched, you can't imagine it wasn't made by magic, strand by strand.
The smell isn't particularly pleasant, and it REALLY stays with you.
Shadow plus fire, what could go wrong?
Even the dead need a lift every now and then.
The favored mount of Highmountain hunters, they can easily leap across the rushing rivers of Pinerock Basin even when saddled with a full-sized Tauren.
Dreamrunners flit between this world and the Emerald Dream at will, reveling in their wild nature.
Moreso than normal hippogryphs, the cloudwings of Azsuna prefer to nest high up in mountain caves far above the cloud line.
The beating of its wings sound like the rolling of thunder in the distance.
It feeds on your thoughts, even the ones you are thinking as you read this.
